intro: Ranunculus cassubicus subsp. pawlowskii, commonly known as the Pawlowski's buttercup, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It features showy, yellow flowers with five to seven petals, typically appearing in early spring. The plant has a basal rosette of leaves that are palmately lobed and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it a distinctive member of the Ranunculaceae family.
